exuber 0.2.1
  • Intro

  • Articles
    • Intro to exuber
  • News

Summarizing radf Models

Source: R/summary.R
summary.Rd

summary method for class "radf"

# S3 method for radf
summary(object, cv, ...)

Arguments

object

An object of class radf().
cv

An object of class "cv". The output of mc_cv(), wb_cv() or sb_cv()
...

further arguments passed to methods, not used.

Value

Returns a list of summary statistics, the t-statistic and the critical values of the ADF, SADF and GSADF.

Examples

# Simulate bubble processes, compute the t-stat and critical values
set.seed(4441)
dta <- cbind(sim_dgp1(n = 100), sim_dgp2(n = 100))
rfd <- radf(dta)

# Summary, diagnostics and datestamp (default)
summary(rfd)
#> 
#>  Recursive Unit Root
#>  ----------------------------------
#>  H0: Unit root
#>  H1: Explosive root
#>  ----------------------------------
#>  Critical values: Monte Carlo 
#>  Minimum window: 19 
#>  Iterations: 2000 
#>  Lag: 0 
#>  ----------------------------------
#>  Series 1 
#>         tstat      90%      95%     99%
#> ADF    -2.538  -0.4035  -0.0762  0.5104
#> SADF    6.218   1.0074   1.3484  1.9454
#> GSADF   6.541   1.6942   1.9259  2.6191
#> 
#>  Series 2 
#>         tstat      90%      95%     99%
#> ADF    -2.579  -0.4035  -0.0762  0.5104
#> SADF    7.027   1.0074   1.3484  1.9454
#> GSADF   7.574   1.6942   1.9259  2.6191
diagnostics(rfd)
#> 
#>  Diagnostics: Individual
#>  -----------------------------------
#> Series 1:
#>  Rejects H0 for significance level 99%
#> Series 2:
#>  Rejects H0 for significance level 99%
#>  ----------------------------------- 
#>  Procced for date stampting and plotting for 2 variable(s)
#>  c("Series 1", "Series 2")
datestamp(rfd)
#> 
#> Datestamp: Individual
#>  -----------------------------------
#> Series 1 :
#>   Start End Duration
#> 1    44  55       12
#> 
#> Series 2 :
#>   Start End Duration
#> 1    22  40       19
#> 2    66  70        5
#> 

#' # Diagnostics for 'sadf'
diagnostics(rfd, option = "sadf")
#> 
#>  Diagnostics: Individual
#>  -----------------------------------
#> Series 1:
#>  Rejects H0 for significance level 99%
#> Series 2:
#>  Rejects H0 for significance level 99%
#>  ----------------------------------- 
#>  Procced for date stampting and plotting for 2 variable(s)
#>  c("Series 1", "Series 2")

# Use log(T)/T rule of thumb to omit periods of explosiveness which are short-lived
rot = round(log(NROW(rfd))/NROW(rfd))
datestamp(rfd, min_duration = rot)
#> 
#> Datestamp: Individual
#>  -----------------------------------
#> Series 1 :
#>   Start End Duration
#> 1    44  55       12
#> 
#> Series 2 :
#>   Start End Duration
#> 1    22  40       19
#> 2    66  70        5
#> 


# Summary, diagnostics and datestamp (Wild Bootstrapped critical values)

wb <- wb_cv(dta)

#> [1] Series 2 out of 2 completed!

summary(rfd, cv = wb)
#> 
#>  Recursive Unit Root
#>  ----------------------------------
#>  H0: Unit root
#>  H1: Explosive root
#>  ----------------------------------
#>  Critical values: Wild Bootstrap 
#>  Minimum window: 19 
#>  Bootstraps: 1000 
#>  Lag: 0 
#>  ----------------------------------
#>  Series 1 
#>        t-stat      90%      95%       99%
#> ADF    -2.538  -0.5608  -0.3907  -0.03226
#> SADF    6.218   2.8552   3.6205   4.96187
#> GSADF   6.541   3.3140   4.0159   5.28444
#> 
#>  Series 2 
#>        t-stat      90%      95%      99%
#> ADF    -2.579  -0.7121  -0.5163  -0.2127
#> SADF    7.027   3.0723   3.7705   5.0310
#> GSADF   7.574   3.9420   4.7036   6.3472
diagnostics(rfd, cv = wb)
#> 
#>  Diagnostics: Individual
#>  -----------------------------------
#> Series 1:
#>  Rejects H0 for significance level 99%
#> Series 2:
#>  Rejects H0 for significance level 99%
#>  ----------------------------------- 
#>  Procced for date stampting and plotting for 2 variable(s)
#>  c("Series 1", "Series 2")
datestamp(rfd, cv = wb)
#> 
#> Datestamp: Individual
#>  -----------------------------------
#> Series 1 :
#>   Start End Duration
#> 1    20  21        2
#> 2    45  55       11
#> 
#> Series 2 :
#>   Start End Duration
#> 1    22  23        2
#> 2    24  40       17
#> 3    66  70        5
#>
